com.stickycoding.Rokon
Class Accelerometer

java.lang.Object
  com.stickycoding.Rokon.Accelerometer

public class Accelerometer
extends java.lang.Object

An interface to manage the Accelerometer sensor Allows the game to extend AccelerometerHandler and manage events triggered by changes or shakes.

Author:
Richard

Method Summary
static int getShakeInterval()
          Returns the minimum interval between firing onShake events
static int getShakeThreshold()
          Returns the minimum intensity of a shake to fire an onShake event
static boolean isListening()
           
static void setShakeInterval(int interval)
          Sets the minimum interval between firing onShake events, default is 1000
static void setShakeThreshold(int threshold)
          Sets the minimum intensity of a shake to fire an onShake event, default is 3000
static void startListening(AccelerometerHandler accelerometerHandler)
          Starts listening for accelerometer changes and shakes.
static void stopListening()
          Removes the AccelerometerListener, it is good practice to do this when it is not needed to save CPU power.

setShakeThreshold

public static void setShakeThreshold(int threshold)
Sets the minimum intensity of a shake to fire an onShake event, default is 3000

getShakeThreshold

public static int getShakeThreshold()
Returns the minimum intensity of a shake to fire an onShake event

Returns:

isListening

public static boolean isListening()
Returns:
TRUE if an AccelerometerListener is active, FALSE if no listener is set

stopListening

public static void stopListening()
Removes the AccelerometerListener, it is good practice to do this when it is not needed to save CPU power.

startListening

public static void startListening(AccelerometerHandler accelerometerHandler)
Starts listening for accelerometer changes and shakes.

Parameters:
accelerometerHandler - Your instance of AccelerometerHandler
